intro: Tracanthelium canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf tangleweed, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It features wiry, ascending stems covered in a dense layer of silvery-white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and often have a slight waxy coating, contributing to its drought tolerance. Tracanthelium canescens is adapted to poor soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
